page.title: 16The churches of Keswick
page.content: St.John's church was built in 1838 by the Marshall family.The church is large and has a large grave yard.It's got twenty four to twenty six people in the choir.On a Sunday two hundred people come to church.One church service goes on for half an hour,and the other for one hour.There is only one bell ringer.There have been ten weddings in the past year. Crosthwaite church was claimed for Christianity in AD 553.But we do not know when it was made.The glass windows were made in the 19th century.The church has 8 bells and 10 bellringers.The longest serving Vicar is Thomas Christian.He was Vicar from 1728 to 1770.There are some very old windows in the church.
